conclusion: To determine which container (E or F) the liquid will flow into, analyze the path of the liquid from each source (A, B, C, and D) as it interacts with the baffles and eventually reaches the containers.
Liquid from A flows downwards and hits the green baffle.
The green baffle is angled towards the left side.
Liquid from A will follow the slope of the green baffle and move towards the left.
Liquid from A will then flow into container E.
Liquid from B flows downwards and hits the cyan baffle.
The cyan baffle is angled towards the right side.
Liquid from B will follow the slope of the cyan baffle and move towards the right.
Liquid from B will then flow into container F.
Liquid from C flows downwards and hits the cyan baffle.
Similar to liquid from B, liquid from C will follow the slope of the cyan baffle and move towards the right.
Liquid from C will then flow into container F.
Liquid from D flows downwards and does not hit any baffle directly.
Liquid from D will fall straight down into container F.
Final Answer: Liquid from A will flow into container E, and liquid from B, C, and D will flow into container F.
